text: What is called the "powerhouse" of a cell because it breaks down nutrients to help make the major energy source of the cell?

choice_a: When tumors are removed through surgery
choice_b: When cancer treatments result in toxic side effects
choice_c: When malignant tumors spread to other parts of the body

text: What term refers to keeping a state of balance in the body?
Which part of the skin is the innermost layer?

justification: The skin tends to yellow with jaundice.

text: In which type of fracture does the bone bend and split, but does not completely break?
Which type of arthritis usually occurs with aging and is known as degenerative joint disease?
Which section of the skeleton forms the main trunk of the body?

choice_a: The origin moves, and the insertion does not.
choice_b: The origin does not move, and the insertion does.
choice_c: Both the origin and insertion move.
choice_d: Neither the origin or insertion move.
justification: The end of the muscle connected to bone that moves is the insertion. The end that does not move is the origin.

text: What type of neuron is also called an interneuron because it carries messages between the other two types of neurons?
In which part of the eye are cones and rods located?
Which of these items are included in the formed elements of blood?
Which of these conditions occurs when the bronchial tubes are inflamed and, as a result, obstructed?
Which body system's main function is to filter the blood and eliminate metabolic waste?
Which of these word roots indicates mouth?

choice_a: Substances dissolved in water or within cells that conduct current
choice_d: Destruction of nutrients before they reach the body cells
